name: Joy of drag
description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

key_work.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
key_work.creator_credit: Stephan Elliott, Michael Hamlyn, Al Clark, Specific Films and Latent Image
key_work.brief_description: When drag queen Anthony (Hugo Weaving) takes his act on the road with fellow cross-dresser Adam (Guy Pearce) and transsexual Bernadette (Terence Stamp). In their colorful bus, Priscilla, the three performers travel across the Australian desert performing for enthusiastic crowds and homophobic locals.

constellations_primary.name: Joy of drag
constellations_primary.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Gender transcending larrikins
constellations_other.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

constellations_other.name: Hiding in plain sight
constellations_other.description: This print of upside-down heads is an early optical illusion featuring hidden characters. Movie studios have continued the tradition of playing with perspective in the bold designs, vivid colours and hidden meanings of film posters.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as Character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

recommendations.quote: The film's three leads have all swapped fabulous frocks for villainous outfits in superhero films. Terrance Stamp was Zod in Superman 2, Hugo Weaving was Red Skull in Captain America: The First Avenger and Guy Pearce was Aldrich Killian in Iron Man 3.

start.title: RuPaul's Drag Race
start.brief_description: Join RuPaul, the world’s most famous drag queen in the ultimate drag competition. America’s top drag queens vie for drag stardom as RuPaul, in full glamazon drag, reigns supreme in all judging and eliminations while helping guide the contestants.

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

end.title: Kitty Powers' Matchmaker
end.brief_description: Kitty Powers’ Matchmaker is a hilarious dating simulator with a difference. Manage your own matchmaking agency with the guidance of your fabulous boss, drag queen diva Kitty Powers!

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

links.description: In 2015, Kitty Powers auditioned to be RuPaul’s Drag Race UK ambassador. Kitty Powers is an English drag queen and game developer, who appears as herself in this dating simulator game.

start.title: Between a Frock and a Hard Place
start.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at how a low-budget Australian film about three drag queens changed the course of history and loudly and proudly brought a celebration of gay culture to the world that continues to resonate decades later.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

end.title: Black Divaz
end.brief_description: This documentary explores the inaugural Miss First Nations competition and goes beyond the glitz, glue guns and glamour of black drag in an intimate portrait of what it means to be an Indigenous drag queen today.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Gender transcending larrikins
constellations_other.description: Australia has a long history with gender creativity and drag culture, both on screen and on stage.

links.description: The soundtrack for Between A Frock And A Hard Place was recorded by Sydney music producer Paul Mac, who also created the soundtrack for Black Divas, which documents Australia’s first Miss First Nations competition.

end.title: TERROR NULLIUS
end.material_description: Single channel video, projection, colour and audio
end.brief_description: Part political satire, eco-horror and road movie, TERROR NULLIUS is a political revenge fable that binds together a documentary impulse with speculative muckraking.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

constellations_other.name: Remix and resistance (Since I left you)
constellations_other.description: The Avalanches' music videos are part of a long artistic tradition of reappropriation as a means of reframing perception.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

links.description: Parts of Priscilla have been editing into Soda_Jerk’s mashup masterpiece, TERROR NULLIS, which like Priscilla, interrogates Australia’s national character.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

links.description: In Black Divas, the queens are told by their competition hosts: “Good luck, and don’t f**k it up”. This iconic line comes from RuPaul’s Drag Race, now in its 11th year of exporting American drag culture to the world.

start.title: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert Adam Whitely / Felicia JollyGoodFellow (Guy Pearce) costume
start.credit_line: Courtesy the National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
start.brief_description: While most of the Oscar-winning costumes in The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert (1994) were made with small budgets and creative solutions, the pom-poms on this iconic wattle dress were made by inmates at the Long Bay Correctional Complex.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

recommendations.quote: The film's three leads have all swapped fabulous frocks for villainous outfits in superhero films. Terrance Stamp was Zod in Superman 2, Hugo Weaving was Red Skull in Captain America: The First Avenger and Guy Pearce was Aldrich Killian in Iron Man 3.

links.description: Costume designers Tim Chappel and Lizzy Gardiner took home the Academy Award for Best Costume Design for their work, like this pom-pom wattle dress, in The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert.

constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

links.description: Drag culture has a long Australian history, gaining world attention with 1994’s Priscilla Queen Of The Desert. The documentary Between A Frock And A Hard Place explores the production of Priscilla through discussion with its stars and producers.

end.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
end.brief_description: Three New York drag queens gets stranded in small town America on their way to a Hollywood beauty pageant. While waiting for parts, the flamboyant trio shows local homophobes their humanity.

constellations_other.name: Joy of drag
constellations_other.description: The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert is a groundbreaking Australian film with a small budget and big impact that's taken queer Australian stories to the world.

constellations_other.name: Dance sequins
constellations_other.description: Looking at dance, ballroom, the Glitter Trilogy and the Red Curtain Trilogy.

links.description: Though they’ve got almost exactly the same premise – three drag queens on a cross country trip – both films were developed independently. While Priscilla was released first, To Wong Foo was already in production.
